purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to specify the cardinalities for a mapping between classes.

ul.li: the class of product 'motor cycle'; and

example.p: that indicates motor cycles have wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:

ul.li: a motor cycle is the whole for two or three wheels;
a wheel is part of zero or one motor cycle.

example.p: The mapping 'motor car front off-side wheel' between:

ul.li: the class of product 'motor car'; and

example.p: that indicates motor cars have front off-side wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:

ul.li: a motor car is the whole for one front off-side wheel;
a wheel is part of zero or one motor car.

example.p: The mapping 'motor car front off-side wheel' between:

ul.li: the class of product 'motor car'; and
the class of product 'front off-side wheel',

example.p: that indicates motor cars have front off-side wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:

ul.li: a motor car is the whole for one front off-side wheel;
a front off-side wheel is part of one motor car.

li.p: the cardinalities for a mapping or relationship between classes

inscope.p: If the mapping or relationship R is between class A and class B, then the module can specify:

ul.li: the possible numbers of members of B that different members of A have a relationship R with;
the possible numbers of members of A that different members of B have a relationship R with.

inscope.example: Each member of 'man' has a relationship 'marriage' with 0 or 1 members of 'woman'. In this example we are recording information about an instant in time, and excluding polygamous marriages.
inscope.note: This information is about the real world, and is not a constraint upon the information that is stored. Not all relationships that exist in the real world need be recorded.
This information is conveyed by symbols at the ends of the relationship lines in a UML class diagram.

li.p: the definition of a mapping or relationship.

uof.name: Cardinality_of_relationship
uof.description: The Cardinality_of_relationship UoF specifies the cardinality of a mapping between two classes.
